title: KernelExplainer fails when link="logit" and probability is 1 or 0
body:
Repro, shap 0.39.0 and sklearn 0.24.1:

```python
import shap
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.linear_model import SGDClassifier
import pytest

X, y = datasets.make_classification(n_samples=100, n_features=20,
                                    n_informative=2, n_redundant=2, random_state=0)

classifier = SGDClassifier(random_state=0, loss="log")
classifier.fit(X, y)

X_valid, _ = datasets.make_classification(n_samples=10, n_features=20,
                                          n_informative=2, n_redundant=2, random_state=1)

with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Input contains NaN, infinity"):
    explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(classifier.predict_proba, X, link="logit")
    shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_valid)
```

The problem is that the classifier outputs probabilities equal to 0 or 1 for some points, which causes `log` to return inf:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41651716/118704534-3a64a400-b7e5-11eb-9054-8b87ff4558ed.png)

I would not expect the KernelExplainer to fail in this case. Users can change the link function but I don't think that's ideal because some may want the shap values to be in the log-odds space.
